success_patterns.name: Greenfield Builder
success_patterns.description: Excels when building something from nothing - infrastructure, processes, territories
evidence: Mixmax: Built 50+ warmed inboxes and prospect infrastructure from scratch
Biofourmis: First/2nd SDR for Commercial Care vertical
TraceAir: 20 demos in September (company record, 18 self-sourced) through creative methodology
success_patterns.implication: Strongest value-add is in 0â†’1 situations, not optimizing existing motions

success_patterns.name: Methodical Prospector
success_patterns.description: Develops systematic, research-driven approaches that outperform activity-based peers
evidence: TraceAir: 21% connection rate vs 4-6% team average
TraceAir: Made 1/3 of team calls but led in demos (20 in record month)
Biofourmis: Targeted hospitals over federal ER readmission limits (compliance-driven prospecting)
success_patterns.implication: Quality over quantity approach conflicts with activity-metric cultures

success_patterns.name: Revenue Generator
success_patterns.description: Creates documented pipeline and closed revenue despite short tenures
evidence: TraceAir: $216,437.50 closed-won revenue (verified via Gmail)
Biofourmis: Orlando Health deal - 90-day close, fastest in company history
Pattern: Generates results faster than typical ramp periods
success_patterns.implication: Impact comes quickly when given autonomy to execute

success_patterns.name: Healthcare/Technical Vertical Expertise
success_patterns.description: Deep domain knowledge in healthcare tech and technical B2B sales
evidence: Biofourmis: Remote patient monitoring, hospital systems, CMS compliance
BCOFA/BariNAV: Bariatric surgery programs, patient navigation
Academic foundation: Mercury research, peer-reviewed publications
success_patterns.implication: Not a generalist SDR - specialized expertise is differentiator

failure_patterns.name: Autonomy Paradox
failure_patterns.description: High performance creates friction with management expectations rather than trust
evidence: Biofourmis: Fired while top performer
TraceAir: Fired while exceeding quota
Mixmax: Contract ended early despite infrastructure delivery
failure_patterns.implication: Needs environments that measure results, not activities
failure_patterns.growth_opportunity: Learn to manage up - communicate WHY the approach works before results prove it

failure_patterns.name: Short Tenure Cycle
evidence: Mixmax: ~3 months
Mobb: ~3 months
TraceAir: ~7 months
Biofourmis: 17 months (longest recent tenure)
root_causes: Possible pattern of deprioritizing relationship management
failure_patterns.implication: Red flag for hiring managers - must address directly
failure_patterns.growth_opportunity: Find companies that explicitly value outcomes over process conformity

failure_patterns.name: Delivery Gap Under Constraints
failure_patterns.description: Can underdeliver when constraints prevent preferred methodology
evidence: Mixmax: 9000 target vs 3770 delivered (42%)
Self-documented and honestly disclosed
root_causes: Method-dependent - struggles when forced into different approach
failure_patterns.implication: Strong when given autonomy, weaker when constrained

growth_patterns.name: Increasing Technical Sophistication
growth_patterns.description: Each role involves more technical infrastructure building
trajectory: Mixmax: Full GTM infrastructure (domains, playbooks, databases)
growth_patterns.implication: Moving from SDR toward GTM Engineering / RevOps

growth_patterns.name: Honesty as Differentiator
evidence: Documents failures alongside wins
Creates 'private' versions with full context
Delivery gap openly disclosed

thrives_in: Complex B2B sales with technical buyers

ideal_next_role.title: GTM Engineer, Founding SDR/AE, Sales Operations
ideal_next_role.industry: Healthcare tech, Security, or technical B2B SaaS

narrative_themes.one_liner: I build GTM infrastructure from scratch. Don't hire me to optimize an existing playbook.
21% connection rate on 1/3 the calls. I find the 20% that matters.
I've been fired twice while hitting quota. Here's what that teaches you.
From mercury research to unicorn deals - I speak both science and sales.
